text: Andrei Nikolaevich Bykanov (born Moscow, 25 May 1980) is a Russian rugby union player. He plays as a scum-half. Bykanov plays for Slava Moscow, in the Rugby Premier League. He had 9 caps for Russia, from 2003 to 2011, without ever scoring. He had his debut at the 43-34 loss to Japan, at 25 May 2003, in Tokyo, for the Super Powers Cup. He was called for the 2011 Rugby World Cup, playing a single game, at the 62-12 loss to Ireland, at 25 September 2011, in Rotorua, without scoring. That would be his last cap for his national team.Andrei Bykanov International Statistics ==References== ==External links== *Andrei Bykanov International Statistics Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:Russian rugby union players Category:Russia international rugby union players Category:Rugby union scrum-halves Category:Slava Moscow players Category:Sportspeople from Moscow
title: Andrei Bykanov
